intro: Buchnera brevibractealis, commonly known as the narrow-bracted buchnera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. It has a compact growth habit and is relatively easy to cultivate in suitable conditions. Buchnera brevibractealis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
